com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.platform.server

Interface Server

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonRestServer, RestServer, TcpReverseProxyServer, TcpServer

    @ThreadSafe
public interface Server
    Represents an I/O server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void shutdown()
      Performs a shutdown procedure.
      Future<?> start()
      Performs a start procedure.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Performs a shutdown procedure. After completion of this method Server doesn't perform I/O and any other operations anymore. This method MUST be idempotent.
        See Also:
        start()

      • start

        Future<?> start()
         throws InterruptedException
        Performs a start procedure. After completion of this method Server is able to perform I/O operations until shutdown() is invoked.

        Once the start() method is called the shutdown() method MUST be called later. A suggested approach to start, wait and shutdown a Server is following: 

        
 final Server server = ...
 try {
        final Future<?> completion = server.start();
        ... // do something else if you need to
        completion.await();
 } catch (final InterruptedException e) {
        // shutdown() called in finally block is our reaction on interruption
        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
 } finally {
        server.shutdown();
 }
        Two invocations of the start() method on the same Server MUST be separated with shutdown() method invocation. Server implementation MUST explicitly specify if it supports multiple start() & shutdown() procedures, otherwise one MUST NOT invoke start() method more than one time for a given Server instance.
        Returns:
        Future that MAY be used to wait till the Server operates. After completion of this Future the method shutdown() MUST be called in order to correctly shutdown the Server.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the current Thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        shutdown()
